Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observers.Observable<Obj>
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
public class Model
extends Observable<Obj>
Class that represents the match as the Model in the MVC pattern.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model()

  • Method Details

    • setWorkerPending

      public void setWorkerPending​(boolean workerPending)
      Checks if there's any worker pending in the choice.
      Parameters:
      workerPending - A boolean: true if there's a worker pending, otherwise false.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(int playersNumber)
      Initializes the match with all the structures needed.
      Parameters:
      playersNumber - Variable that indicates the number of players of the lobby.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player player)
      Adds the player to the game.
      Parameters:
      player - Variable that indicates which player is being added to the game.

    • challengerStart

      public void challengerStart()
      Chooses randomly the challenger of the game then asks him to choose the GodCards for the game.

    • randomChooseChallenger

      public void randomChooseChallenger()
      Chooses a random challenger between the available players at the start of the game.

    • showCompleteGodList

      public void showCompleteGodList()
      Prints out the complete God List to the challenger for the choice of God Cards.

    • defineGodList

      public boolean defineGodList​(java.lang.String god)
      Handles the choice of a God Card by the Challenger and adds it the the current God List.
      Parameters:
      god - Variable that represents which particular God was chosen by the Challenger.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if the choice was correct and all God Powers are defined by the Challenger, otherwise false.

    • nextChoiceGod

      public void nextChoiceGod()
      Handles the choice of the God Cards throughout all the players after the Challenger chose the current GodList.

    • showGodList

      public void showGodList()
      Shows the current GodList to the player at issue.

    • chooseGod

      public boolean chooseGod​(java.lang.String god)
      Handles the selection of the God and sets up the player and his workers with the chosen God Powers.
      Parameters:
      god - Variable which is a string that indicates which God was chosen by the player.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if the God chosen was in the current GodList and assigned to the player, otherwise false.

    • setStartingPlayer

      public boolean setStartingPlayer​(java.lang.String startingPlayerNickname)
      Selects the starting player of the game.
      Parameters:
      startingPlayerNickname - A variable which is a string that represents the nickname of the chosen player.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if the nickname was validated and the starting player was set, otherwise false.

    • checkTurn

      public boolean checkTurn​(java.lang.String playerNickname)
      Checks if the player who sent the messages is the owner of the current turn, as only him is allowed to do actions in his turn.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - A variable which is a string that represents the nickname of the player at issue,
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if the player is the owner of the current turn, otherwise false.

    • checkAnswer

      public boolean checkAnswer​(GameMessage gMessage)
      Handles the choice between two of the workers and the usage of the GodPower.
      Parameters:
      gMessage - Variable that indicates which choice is to be made: worker selection or GodPower usage.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if:

      -the worker is chosen.

      -the chosen worker is confirmed to be the one chosen.

      -the GodPower is confirmed to be used.

      Otherwise false.

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Gets the board associated with the Model.
      Returns:
      The Board object of the current match.

    • sendBoard

      public void sendBoard()
      Send an update of the board to the clients.

    • createBoardView

      public BoardView createBoardView()
      Handles the BoardView based on the updates of the changes to the Model.

      Use of the state of the worker to determine which type of operation is being issued.

      Returns:
      The updated BoardView after every action.

    • getNextPlayerIndex

      public int getNextPlayerIndex()
      Finds the index of the player which turn is next.
      Returns:
      An integer that represents the player's index, otherwise 0 at the end of every cycle of turns equals to the number of players in the game.

    • getPlayersNumber

      public int getPlayersNumber()
      Gets the players number of the game.
      Returns:
      An integer which represents the number of the players.

    • getConditions

      public Conditions getConditions()
      Gets the conditions imposed by some particular Gods of the current game.
      Returns:
      An object Conditions that encapsulates the some extra rules of the game.

    • getMatchPlayersList

      public java.util.List<Player> getMatchPlayersList()
      Gets a List of the players of the game.
      Returns:
      A List of Players objects which represents the Players currently in the game.

    • getChallengerID

      public int getChallengerID()
      Gets the ID of the challenger.
      Returns:
      An integer which represents the ID of the challenger player.

    • getStartingPlayerID

      public int getStartingPlayerID()
      Gets the ID of the starting player of the game.
      Returns:
      An integer which represents the ID of the starting player of the game.

    • setStartingPlayerID

      public void setStartingPlayerID​(int id)
      Sets the ID of the starting player of the game.
      Parameters:
      id - Variable that represents the ID of the starting player of the current game.

    • getGodsList

      public GodList getGodsList()
      Gets the GodList of the current game.
      Returns:
      An object GodList that encapsulates information about God Power choices in the game.

    • startTurn

      public void startTurn()
      Sets the defined starting player as the current player and starts the flow of the turns.

    • getCurrentTurn

      public Turn getCurrentTurn()
      Gets the current turn of the game.
      Returns:
      A Turn object that encapsulates information about the current turn of the game.

    • commandToTile

      public Tile commandToTile​(int row, int column)
      Associates a command to a specific tile of the current board.
      Parameters:
      row - Row value of the chosen Tile.
      column - Column value of the chosen Tile.
      Returns:
      A Tile object that is the one selected from the command.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String tag, java.lang.String arg)
      Sends a message to the current player at issue.
      Parameters:
      tag - Variable that gives more information about the type and use of the message sent.
      arg - Variable that represents the message to be sent.

    • unicastMsg

      public void unicastMsg​(Obj obj)
      Sends an unicast Message to the client of the current player.
      Parameters:
      obj - Variable that represents the message that needs to be cast.

    • broadcast

      public void broadcast​(Obj obj)
      Sends a broadcast to all the players currently in the game.
      Parameters:
      obj - Variable that represents the message that needs to be broadcast.

    • operation

      public void operation()
      Gets the current state of the turn and casts it to the current player.

    • place

      public void place()
      Sending a place worker request to the current player.

    • placeWorker

      public void placeWorker​(int indexWorker)
      Asks the user to choose the placement of the board of the specified worker.
      Parameters:
      indexWorker - Variable that indicates the selected worker that needs to be placed.

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin()
      Checks if the worker satisfies any winning condition.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if any winning condition is met, otherwise false.

    • checkLose

      public boolean checkLose()
      Checks if the worker satisfies any losing condition.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if any losing condition is met, otherwise false.

    • lose

      public void lose​(Player player)
      Handles the loss of a player. If current players in game are more than 2, the lost player will have the workers removed and continue to watch the match as a spectator. If there are only 2 remaining players, the player who doesn't lose automatically win and the game ends.
      Parameters:
      player - Variable that indicates the player that lost.

    • isWorkerChosen

      public boolean isWorkerChosen()
      Checks if in the current state of game there is any worker chosen.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if there is a chosen worker, otherwise false.

    • setWorkerChosen

      public void setWorkerChosen​(boolean workerChosen)
      Sets the workerChosen variable.
      Parameters:
      workerChosen - Variable that represents a worker is chosen by the player.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Broadcasts a message that the game ended. The receiver of this message is the last one of the players' list, it should handle the match disconnection.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.
      Returns:
      A boolean: true if the game is over, otherwise false.

    • createTotalWorkerList

      public void createTotalWorkerList()
      Creates the total list of workers in the game.

    • getTotalWorkers

      public java.util.List<UndecoratedWorker> getTotalWorkers()
      Gets the total list of workers in the game.
      Returns:
      A List of workers.
